channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Cotangent Bundles as Coadjoint Orbits and Asymptotic Character Formulas
item.description: arXiv:2506.10519v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The present article presents geometric quantization on cotangent bundles as a special instance of Kirillov's orbit method. To this end, the cotangent bundle is realized as a coadjoint orbit of an infinite-dimensional Lie group constructed from the diffeomorphism group. We also develop two asymptotic character formulas by employing the tangent groupoid.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gjertsen, Alexander Schmeding

item.title: A Poincar\'e--Birkhoff theorem for $C^0$-Hamiltonian maps
item.description: arXiv:2506.10545v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove a higher-dimensional version of the well-known Poincar\'e--Birkhoff theorem, using Floer homology. We also prove a relative version for Lagrangian submanifolds. The motivation is finding periodic orbits and Hamiltonian chords in the circular, restricted three-body problem.
item.dc:creator: Arthur Limoge, Agustin Moreno

item.title: Moduli spaces of spacefilling branes in symplectic 4-manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2501.07926v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: On a symplectic manifold $(M, \omega)$, a spacefilling brane structure is a closed 2-form $F$ which determines a complex structure, with respect to which $F +i\omega$ is holomorphic symplectic. For holomorphic symplectic compact K\"ahler 4-manifolds, we show that the moduli space of spacefilling branes is smooth, and determine its dimension. The proof relies on the local Torelli theorem for K3 surfaces and tori.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Kirchhoff-Lukat, Marco Zambon

item.title: Contact line bundles, foliations, and integrability
item.description: arXiv:2502.02935v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We formulate the non-commutative integrability of contact systems on a contact manifold $(M,\mathcal H)$ using the Jacobi structure on the space of sections $\Gamma(L)$ of a contact line bundle $L$. In the cooriented case, if the line bundle is trivial and $\mathcal H$ is the kernel of a globally defined contact form $\alpha$, the Jacobi structure on the space of sections reduces to the standard Jacobi structure on $(M,\alpha)$. We therefore treat contact systems on cooriented and non-cooriented contact manifolds simultaneously. In particular, this allows us to work with dissipative Hamiltonian systems where the Hamiltonian does not have to be preserved by the Reeb vector field.
item.dc:creator: Bozidar Jovanovic

item.title: Homogeneous bi-Hamiltonian structures and integrable contact systems
item.description: arXiv:2502.17269v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Bi-Hamiltonian structures can be utilised to compute a maximal set of functions in involution for certain integrable systems, given by the eigenvalues of the recursion operator relating both Poisson structures. We show that the recursion operator relating two compatible Jacobi structures cannot produce a maximal set of functions in involution. However, as we illustrate with an example, bi-Hamiltonian structures can still be used to obtain a maximal set of functions in involution on a contact manifold, at the cost of symplectisation.
item.dc:creator: Leonardo Colombo, Manuel de Le\'on, Mar\'ia Emma Eyrea Iraz\'u, Asier L\'opez-Gord\'on

item.title: Reduction of hybrid Hamiltonian systems with non-equivariant momentum maps
item.description: arXiv:2503.22290v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We develop a reduction scheme \`a la Marsden-Weinstein-Meyer for hybrid Hamiltonian systems. Our method does not require the momentum map to be equivariant, neither to be preserved by the impact map. We illustrate the applicability of our theory with an example.
item.dc:creator: Leonardo Colombo, Mar\'ia Emma Eyrea Iraz\'u, Mar\'ia Eugenia Garc\'ia, Asier L\'opez-Gord\'on, Marcela Zuccalli
